message.entry: Input object keypoint detector name must be a valid pretrained HRNet deep learning network.
Dimension of input data of numeric type cannot exceed 4.
Input must be either a numeric array or a datastore.
Threshold value must be scalar.
Invalid keypoint classes. Specify keypoint classes as a string array, a cell array of character vectors, or a categorical array.
Keypoint classes must be unique.
Height and width of input image must be divisible by 32.
ImageDatastore object must have images and bounding boxes.
Bounding box must be a 4-element vector.
Bounding box height and width must be less than or equal to the respective height and width of the image.
Keypoint connections must be a matrix of size J-by-2 where each row represents a pair of Keypoint class indices.
The number of keypoints, scores, and validity flags must match the number of Keypoint classes.
The number of objects in the scores, keypoints, and validity flag must be the same.
The KeyPoints must be two-dimensional.
Bounding boxes value must not be empty.
Specify a valid pretrained network as input.
Keypoint classes must be specified in order to configure the network for transfer learning.
MAT-file does not exist.
No object of class hrnetObjectKeypointDetector in MAT-file.
Specified MAT-file must contain only one hrnetObjectKeypointDetector object.
Input image must be single RGB image.
The indices of the keypoint connections must be less than the total number of keypoint classes.
Datastore must return cell array on the read method with 2 cell, first cell for image and second for bounding box.
Training a HRNet Object Keypoint Detector for the following keypoint classes:
Supported GPU not found. Update the 'ExecutionEnvironment' on trainingOptions to 'cpu'. Or, to automatically determine if a GPU is available, use 'auto'.
Keypoint detector training complete.
The number of channels in training images and inputSize must be same.
The trainingData must either be a valid transformed or combined datastore.
The number of keypoints must be N-by-2 or N-by-3 where N is number of keypoint classes.
Visibility must be either zero or one.
The number of keypoints must be equal to number of keypoint classes.
Bounding box must be positive.
Height and width of bounding box can not be unit size.
Number of keypoints set and bounding box must be same.
Computing Input Normalization Statistics.
The input image to the 'detect' method must be fixed-size for code generation.
Code generation does not support the argument ''{1}'' passed to ''{0}'' method. This argument will be ignored.
